snippet: The study, conducted by the Straphangers Campaign, focused on so-called controllable delays — problems associated with signals, switches and tracks, among other factors.
abstract: Study conducted by Straphangers Campaign finds increase in New York City subway delays in 2012, even in months before Hurricane Sandy; study focused on so-called controllable delays--problems associated with signals, switches, tracks or other factors deemed controllable by Metropolitan Transportation Authority.
lead_paragraph: The study, conducted by the Straphangers Campaign, focused on so-called controllable delays — problems associated with signals, switches and tracks, among other factors.

headline.seo: Subway Delays Increased Last Year, Group Finds
headline.main: Subway Delays Were Up in 2012, a Group Finds
headline.print_headline: Subway Delays Were Up in 2012, A Group Finds
